p: Sixty‐three cats met the inclusion criteria and were enrolled in the study. Patients were divided into two groups according to ultrasonographic signs: cats with concurrent involvement of pancreas, liver and intestine (Group A, n = 19) and cats with concurrent involvement of only two organs between pancreas, liver and intestine (Group B, n = 44). Differences between groups were statistically investigated by Mann‐Whitney test for iron, and Unpaired t‐test for anemia parameters. Categorical data were analyzed with Fisher's exact test.
